column4: btw what's the difference between chromium and google chrome?
Chrome is  based on chromium.  Chromium is open source, and Chrome is not
just like that Google Chrome OS that is coming out later this year,   it's based on Chromeium OS
well they given source code to the open source community, and then they make their own one
and I guess it will only be mainly  Desktop Linux people that will know about Chromeium browser and Chromeium  OS,   Google will advertise Chrome browser and Chrome OS
apparantly Chrome is better than Chromeium,  however I don't use either, since  I think it's better to support Firefox
dunno if it's international. it's a music streaming website
fully legal, you can't dl the musics but it's very useful
but no one is perfect: full flash and so on

try Flash with  Epiphany  and Galeon   sudo apt-get install epiphany-browser not just epiphany on it's own or you get a game, (that's right  Desktop Linux is for gaming as well, despite what certain people think)
If your using Arch, why are you here?
to help people under ubuntu ^^ (i used to use this distro for a long time)
ok that's a bit like me,  I am on Mandriva right now, but here to help with Ubuntu,  since that's the distro that has most chance at gaining a more proper market share, at the moment
plus it has a lot more users in the channel than say Mandriva,  more fun to help in big channels I think
yeah sure :D archlinux channel has 600 users not that bad
